items.title: [Figma] Card in card

labels.name: design
labels.description: Applied to all issues assigned to the design team members.  Filter used in planning meetings

items.body:
Add the `Card in card` component to Figma kit. Remember we are only building variants for `xlg`, `md`, and `sm`.

[Design specs](https://ibm.ent.box.com/folder/132489332751?s=jad2fd65p56odcme9aoy1lgmuo1xaifu)
[Website](https://www.ibm.com/standards/carbon/components/cards#card-in-card)

**Must haves:**
- [ ] Content should be flexible - the designer should be able to condense or stretch the component and the content should respond. Removing text for example should maintain the right padding automatically through auto layout.
- [ ] Use the `Card - basic` component in this one.
- [ ] `Card in card` can have a video or an image in the background. Give designers the option to swap using variants. Image should be the default. Use any existing Image or Video components in this component.
- [ ] For the video version, the card content should use the video icon for the CTA (see the design specs).
- [ ] Should include all interactive states (Enabled, Hover, Active, Focus)

**Resources**
- C4IBM.com Component checklist is available in the Read Me ðŸ‘€ page of the Figma library
- [Bases demo](https://secure.video.ibm.com/channel/23570833/playlist/641336/video/131117161) from the Figma Fridays (Episode 23)
- Reference the [best practices](https://www.figma.com/file/8n9IJtHnICSydODoYl4ueW/Figma-Best-Practices?node-id=52%3A6706) from Figma guild
- Info on [auto layout](https://www.figma.com/proto/RQhu2NWQVr1JDaU4mpRuZh/Figma-Exercises?node-id=422%3A2366&scaling=min-zoom&page-id=52%3A6706&starting-point-node-id=422%3A2366)

items.title: [Card] HTML entities not displaying correctly in Card copy

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: Work necessary for the Carbon for IBM.com react components package

labels.name: severity 4
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, no workaround needed

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

items.body:
### Description

When using HTML entities in the Card storybook knobs, they don't appear to be encoded correctly

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8265238/138314887-2c7bf986-9db4-487e-86a1-7d331f7bd840.png)

This may be a Storybook knobs issue with escaping HTML, but potentially related https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues/7469

### Component(s) impacted

Card

### Browser

_No response_

### Carbon for IBM.com version

canary

### Severity

Severity 3 = The problem is visible or noticeable to users but does not impede the usability or functionality. Affects minor functionality, has a workaround.

### Application/website

-

### Package

@carbon/ibmdotcom-react, @carbon/ibmdotcom-web-components

### CodeSandbox example

https://ibmdotcom-web-components-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default

### Steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)

visit the [Web Components](https://ibmdotcom-web-components-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default) or [React storybook](https://ibmdotcom-react-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/components-card--default)

try entering HTML entities in the story knobs


### Release date (if applicable)

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/blob/master/.github/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] I checked the [current issues](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues) for duplicate issues

items.title: [Card in card] `md` design enhancement

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

items.body:
Currently, the Card in card component at `md` breakpoint looks huge, the text card drops below image, and can be as wide as 1055px. 

### Current design for `md`: 

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5be09c3a6102900c6d16d991/f0c2089a-9595-41e8-b0ee-3049d3856676)

### Proposed design for `md`: 

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5be09c3a6102900c6d16d991/0deecf68-f6b6-4e44-9818-5d8e52c0e0e7)

### Final design for `md`:

Files are in [their Box folder](https://ibm.box.com/s/5zuscw5rfdi74syu2d93e5l6k5ou9x86).

items.title: [CTA] Missing Card Link CTA in React

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: Work necessary for the Carbon for IBM.com react components package

labels.name: severity 3
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, has a workaround

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

items.body:
Describe the issue: 

> What did you expect to happen? What happened instead? 

As discussed with the team, there are considerable gaps on how Card CTA is currently structured. Some of the highlights:

- Card CTA is using CardLink under the hood. We have decided that this should be changed to be Card Link CTA, and adjust so that it properly uses the Card Link styles.
- A true Card CTA needs to be created based on Card (not Card Link)
- A number of patches were made in order to align Card / Card Link / CTA as best as possible compared to the Web Components version. A number of `FIXME` comments have been identified in the code base and needs to be addressed when tackling this.
- Should double-check if there are storybook authoring issues, or swap out CardLinkCTA in content block/group components

> Component(s) impacted? Please include screenshots, or code and relevant URLs.

Card, CardLink, CTA

Please provide any additional notes:

- Original issue https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/issues/5740 was created and closed, but didn't fully address all of the discrepancies
- PR under the expressive sunset attempts to address this, partially in final fixes (in web components), and others in patches as there isn't a clear distinction between Card CTA and Card Link CTA in React yet: https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/pull/7056

items.title: [Card in card]: Web Components: Prod QA testing of 'md' breakpoint design changes

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: QA
labels.description: QA testing work performed by the testing team members

labels.name: package: web components
labels.description: Work necessary for the IBM.com Library web components package

items.body:
<!-- Avoid any type of solutions in this user story -->
<!-- replace _{{...}}_ with your own words or remove -->

#### User Story
<!-- {{Provide a detailed description of the user's need here, but avoid any type of solutions}} -->
> As a `[user role below]`:
developer using the ibm.com Library `Card in card`

> I need to:
have a version of the component that has been tested for accessibility compliance as well as on multiple browsers and platforms 

> so that I can:
be confident that my ibm.com web site users will have a good experience

#### Additional information
<!--  {{Please provide any additional information or resources for reference}} -->
- [Browser Stack link](https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/578734426612)
- [Browser Standard](https://w3.ibm.com/standards/web/browser/) 
- Browser versions to be tested:  Tier 1 browsers will be tested with defects created as Sev 1 or Sev 2.  Tier 2 browser defects will be created as Sev 3 defects.
- Platforms to be tested, by priority:  1)  Desktop  2)  Mobile
- Mobile iOS versions: 13.1, 13.3 and 14
- Mobile Android versions: 9.0 and 10
- Browsers to be tested:  Desktop: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, Mobile: Chrome, Safari, Samsung Internet, UC Browser, QQ Browser
- [Accessibility testing guidance](https://pages.github.ibm.com/IBMa/able/Test/verify/)
 - [Accessibility Checklist](https://www.ibm.com/able/guidelines/ci162/accessibility_checklist.html)
 - [Creating a QA bug](https://ibm.ent.box.com/notes/603242247385)
- **See the Epic (#7355 ) for the Design and Functional specs information**
- Design files are in [their Box folder](https://ibm.box.com/s/5zuscw5rfdi74syu2d93e5l6k5ou9x86).
 - Web Components Dev issue (#7667) 
- Once development is finished the updated code is available in the [**Web Components Canary Environment**](https://ibmdotcom-web-components-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/overview-getting-started--page) for testing.
- [**React canary environment**](https://ibmdotcom-react-canary.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/overview-getting-started--page)
- **[Web Components Wrapper test env URL](https://ibmdotcom-web-components-react.mybluemix.net/?path=/story/*)**

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Accessibility testing is complete.  Component is compliant.
- [ ] All browser versions are tested
- [ ] All operating systems are tested
- [ ] All devices are tested
- [ ] Defects are recorded

items.title: [Card] Allow text link on Card in all situations

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

items.body:
### The problem

Hi team

My client hopes to add link text to the link of each card in the card group component, but we found that there is no component that can be used, could you please help to update the component?

Thank you.

### The solution

we want to add the link text on the card group component, now we just add title, description, link.

### Application/website

https://www.ibm.com/strategic-partnerships/fr-fr/ois/

### Business priority

High Priority = pressing release

### What time frame would this ideally be needed by (if applicable)

_No response_

### Examples

_No response_

Ensure the `Card` component has been tested and reviewed by design + dev.

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Pattern is reviewed by designer and design defects are identified
- [ ] New issues are opened to log individual defects
- [ ] Screenshots of as-is and to-be design should be added to the issue when needed
- [ ] Developer associated with building the pattern is assigned to the new issues
- [ ] Appropriate labels are added to the issue  eg.  bug, dev

items.title: [Card] React: Update to allow text link in all situations (schedule before WC dev work)

labels.name: Feature request
labels.description: A new adopter requested feature

labels.name: package: react
labels.description: Work necessary for the Carbon for IBM.com react components package

labels.name: dev
labels.description: Needs some dev work

items.body:
#### User Story
<!-- {{Provide a detailed description of the user's need here, but avoid any type of solutions}} -->
> As a `[user role below]`:
Carbon for ibm.com developer

> I need to:
create/change the `Card`

> so that I can:
provide the ibm.com adopter developers components they can use to build ibm.com web pages

#### Additional information
<!--  {{Please provide any additional information or resources for reference}} -->
- Story within Storybook with corresponding knobs
- Utilize Carbon
- **See the Epic (#7631 ) for the Design and Functional specs information**
- This FR was created by Geo Pei.  They use react framework.
- WC dev issue (#7683 )
- React Visual QA testing issue (#7684 )
- Prod QA testing issue (#7686 )

#### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Built as a pure React component/variant
- [ ] Include README for the react component and corresponding styles
- [ ] Add any necessary stable selectors
- [ ] Create codesandbox example under `/packages/react/examples/codesandbox` and include in README
- [ ] Minimum 80% unit test coverage
- [ ] Update the Carbon for ibm.com website component [data file](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom-website/blob/master/src/data/components.json) to be sure the web site Component Status and Storybook links are correct
- [ ] Use the [Visual QA checklist](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon-for-ibm-dotcom/wiki/Definition-of-done-(Visual-QA-checklist)) to verify design quality
- [ ] Update the e2e test scripts, if needed. 
- [ ] Confirm e2e test results have no major errors.
- [ ] If a design is provided, the Designer is included as a Reviewer in the Pull Request
- [ ] Provide a direct link to the deploy preview for the designer in the Pull Request description
- [ ] A comment is posted in the Prod QA issue, tagging Praveen when development is finished
